00043 namespace sc_core {
00044 
00045 inline
00046 bool
00047 sc_writer_policy_check_write::check_write( sc_object* target, bool /*value_changed*/ )
00048 {
00049   sc_process_b* writer_p = sc_get_curr_simcontext()->get_current_writer();
00050   if( SC_UNLIKELY_( !m_writer_p.valid() ) ) {
00051     // always store first writer
00052     sc_process_handle( writer_p ).swap( m_writer_p );
00053   } else if( SC_UNLIKELY_(m_writer_p != writer_p && writer_p != 0) ) {
00054     // Alternative option: only flag error, if either
00055     //  - we enforce conflicts across multiple evaluation phases, or
00056     //  - the new value is different from the previous write
00057     //if( !m_delta_only || value_changed )
00058     {
00059       sc_signal_invalid_writer( target, m_writer_p, writer_p, m_delta_only );
00060       // error has been suppressed, accept check as well,
00061       // but update current writer to the last "successful" one
00062       sc_process_handle( writer_p ).swap( m_writer_p );
00063     }
00064   }
00065   return true;
00066 }
00067 
00068 
00069 inline void
00070 sc_writer_policy_check_write::update()
00071 {
00072   if( m_delta_only ) // reset, if we're only checking for delta conflicts
00073     sc_process_handle().swap( m_writer_p );
00074 }

00077 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00078 //  CLASS : sc_signal_channel
00079 //
00080 //  The sc_signal type-agnostic primitive channel base class.
00081 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00082 
00083 class SC_API sc_signal_channel
00084   : public sc_prim_channel
00085 {
00086 protected:
00087 
00088     sc_signal_channel( const char* name_ )
00089       : sc_prim_channel( name_ )
00090       , m_change_event_p( 0 )
00091       , m_change_stamp( ~sc_dt::UINT64_ONE )
00092     {}
00093 
00094 public:
00095 
00096     virtual ~sc_signal_channel();
00097 
00098     // interface methods
00099 
00100     virtual const char* kind() const
00101         { return "sc_signal_channel"; }
00102 
00103     // get the default event
00104     const sc_event& default_event() const
00105         { return value_changed_event(); }
00106 
00107     // get the value changed event
00108     const sc_event& value_changed_event() const;
00109 
00110     // was there an event?
00111     bool event() const
00112         { return simcontext()->event_occurred(m_change_stamp); }
00113 
00114 protected:
00115     void do_update();
00116 
00117     // reporting to avoid code bloat in sc_signal_t
00118 
00119     void deprecated_get_data_ref()  const;
00120     void deprecated_get_new_value() const;
00121     void deprecated_trace()         const;
00122 
00123     sc_event* lazy_kernel_event( sc_event**, const char* ) const;
00124     void notify_next_delta( sc_event* ev ) const
00125         { if( ev ) ev->notify_next_delta(); }
00126 
00127 protected:
00128     mutable sc_event* m_change_event_p;  // value change event if present.
00129     sc_dt::uint64     m_change_stamp;    // delta of last event
00130 
00131 private:
00132     // disabled
00133     sc_signal_channel( const sc_signal_channel& ) /* = delete */;
00134     sc_signal_channel& operator=( const sc_signal_channel& ) /* = delete */;
00135 };
00136 
00137 
00138 inline
00139 ::std::ostream&
00140 operator << ( ::std::ostream& os, const sc_signal_channel& a )
00141 {
00142     a.print( os );
00143     return os;
00144 }

00147 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00148 //  CLASS : sc_signal_t<T, POL> (implementation-defined)
00149 //
00150 //  The generic sc_signal<T,POL> primitive channel base class
00151 //  (to reduce complexity of specialisations for bool and sc_logic)
00152 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00153 
00154 template< class T, sc_writer_policy POL >
00155 class sc_signal_t
00156   : public    sc_signal_inout_if<T>
00157   , public    sc_signal_channel
00158   , protected sc_writer_policy_check<POL>
00159 {
00160 protected:
00161     typedef sc_signal_inout_if<T>       if_type;
00162     typedef sc_signal_channel           base_type;
00163     typedef sc_signal_t<T,POL>          this_type;
00164     typedef sc_writer_policy_check<POL> policy_type;
00165 
00166 protected:
00167 
00168     // constructor and destructor
00169 
00170     sc_signal_t( const char* name_, const T& initial_value_ )
00171       : base_type( name_ )
00172       , m_cur_val( initial_value_ )
00173       , m_new_val( initial_value_ )
00174     {}
00175 
00176     virtual ~sc_signal_t() {} /* = default; */
00177 
00178 public:
00179 
00180     // interface methods
00181 
00182     virtual const char* kind() const
00183         { return "sc_signal"; }
00184 
00185     virtual void register_port( sc_port_base&, const char* );
00186 
00187     virtual sc_writer_policy get_writer_policy() const
00188       { return POL; }
00189 
00190     // get the default event
00191     virtual const sc_event& default_event() const
00192       { return value_changed_event(); }
00193 
00194     // get the value changed event
00195     virtual const sc_event& value_changed_event() const
00196         { return base_type::value_changed_event(); }
00197 
00198     // read the current value
00199     virtual const T& read() const
00200         { return m_cur_val; }
00201 
00202     // get a reference to the current value (for tracing)
00203     virtual const T& get_data_ref() const
00204     {
00205         deprecated_get_data_ref();
00206         return m_cur_val;
00207     }
00208 
00209     // was there an event?
00210     virtual bool event() const
00211         { return base_type::event(); }
00212 
00213     // write the new value
00214     virtual void write( const T& );
00215 
00216 
00217     // other methods
00218 
00219     operator const T& () const
00220         { return read(); }
00221 
00222 
00223     // assignment
00224     this_type& operator = ( const T& a )
00225       { write( a ); return *this; }
00226 
00227     this_type& operator = ( const sc_signal_in_if<T>& a )
00228       { write( a.read() ); return *this; }
00229 
00230     this_type& operator = ( const this_type& a )
00231       { write( a.read() ); return *this; }
00232 
00233 
00234     const T& get_new_value() const
00235     {
00236         deprecated_get_new_value();
00237         return m_new_val;
00238     }
00239 
00240 
00241     void trace( sc_trace_file* tf ) const
00242         { 
00243             deprecated_trace();
00244 #           ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00245                 sc_trace( tf, read(), name() ); 
00246 #           else
00247                 if ( tf ) {}
00248 #           endif
00249         }
00250 
00251 
00252     virtual void print( ::std::ostream& = ::std::cout ) const;
00253     virtual void dump( ::std::ostream& = ::std::cout ) const;
00254 
00255 
00256 protected:
00257 
00258     virtual void update();
00259             void do_update();
00260 
00261 protected:
00262     T m_cur_val;         // current value of object.
00263     T m_new_val;         // next value of object.
00264 
00265 private:
00266     // disabled
00267     sc_signal_t( const sc_signal_t& ) /* = delete */;
00268 };
00269 
00270 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00271 
00272 template< class T, sc_writer_policy POL >
00273 inline
00274 void
00275 sc_signal_t<T,POL>::register_port( sc_port_base& port_
00276                                  , const char* if_typename_ )
00277 {
00278     bool is_output = std::string( if_typename_ ) == typeid(if_type).name();
00279     if( !policy_type::check_port( this, &port_, is_output ) )
00280        ((void)0); // fallback? error has been suppressed ...
00281 }
00282 
00283 
00284 // write the new value
00285 
00286 template< class T, sc_writer_policy POL >
00287 inline
00288 void
00289 sc_signal_t<T,POL>::write( const T& value_ )
00290 {
00291     // first write per eval phase: m_new_val == m_cur_val
00292     bool value_changed = !( m_new_val == value_ );
00293     if ( !policy_type::check_write(this, value_changed) )
00294         return;
00295 
00296     m_new_val = value_;
00297     if( value_changed || policy_type::needs_update() ) {
00298         request_update();
00299     }
00300 }
00301 
00302 
00303 template< class T, sc_writer_policy POL >
00304 inline
00305 void
00306 sc_signal_t<T,POL>::print( ::std::ostream& os ) const
00307 {
00308     os << m_cur_val;
00309 }
00310 
00311 template< class T, sc_writer_policy POL >
00312 void
00313 sc_signal_t<T,POL>::dump( ::std::ostream& os ) const
00314 {
00315     os << "     name = " << name() << ::std::endl;
00316     os << "    value = " << m_cur_val << ::std::endl;
00317     os << "new value = " << m_new_val << ::std::endl;
00318 }
00319 
00320 
00321 template< class T, sc_writer_policy POL >
00322 void
00323 sc_signal_t<T,POL>::update()
00324 {
00325     policy_type::update();
00326     if( !( m_new_val == m_cur_val ) ) {
00327         do_update();
00328     }
00329 }
00330 
00331 template< class T, sc_writer_policy POL >
00332 inline void
00333 sc_signal_t<T,POL>::do_update()
00334 {
00335     base_type::do_update();
00336     m_cur_val = m_new_val;
00337 }
00338 
00339 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00340 //  CLASS : sc_signal<T, POL>
00341 //
00342 //  The sc_signal<T,POL> primitive channel class
00343 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00344 
00345 template< class T, sc_writer_policy POL /* = SC_DEFAULT_WRITER_POLICY */ >
00346 class sc_signal
00347   : public sc_signal_t<T,POL>
00348 {
00349 public:
00350     typedef sc_signal_inout_if<T>       if_type;
00351     typedef sc_signal_t<T,POL>          base_type;
00352     typedef sc_signal<T,POL>            this_type;
00353     typedef T                           value_type;
00354     typedef sc_writer_policy_check<POL> policy_type;
00355 
00356     // constructors and destructor
00357 
00358     sc_signal()
00359       : base_type( sc_gen_unique_name( "signal" ), value_type() )
00360     {}
00361 
00362     explicit
00363     sc_signal( const char* name_ )
00364       : base_type( name_, value_type() )
00365     {}
00366 
00367     sc_signal( const char* name_, const value_type& initial_value_ )
00368       : base_type( name_, initial_value_ )
00369     {}
00370 
00371     virtual ~sc_signal() {} /* = default; */
00372 
00373     // assignment
00374     this_type& operator = ( const value_type& a )
00375       { base_type::operator=(a); return *this; }
00376 
00377     this_type& operator = ( const sc_signal_in_if<value_type>& a )
00378       { base_type::operator=(a); return *this; }
00379 
00380     this_type& operator = ( const this_type& a )
00381       { base_type::operator=(a); return *this; }
00382 
00383 private:
00384     // disabled
00385     sc_signal( const sc_signal& ) /* = delete */;
00386 };

00389 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00390 //  CLASS : sc_signal<bool>
00391 //
00392 //  Specialization of sc_signal<T> for type bool.
00393 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00394 
00395 class SC_API sc_reset;
00396 
00397 SC_API_TEMPLATE_DECL_ sc_signal_t<bool,SC_ONE_WRITER>;
00398 SC_API_TEMPLATE_DECL_ sc_signal_t<bool,SC_MANY_WRITERS>;
00399 SC_API_TEMPLATE_DECL_ sc_signal_t<bool,SC_UNCHECKED_WRITERS>;
00400 
00401 template< sc_writer_policy POL >
00402 class SC_API sc_signal<bool,POL>
00403   : public sc_signal_t<bool,POL>
00404 {
00405 protected:
00406     typedef sc_signal_t<bool,POL>       base_type;
00407     typedef sc_signal<bool,POL>         this_type;
00408     typedef bool                        value_type;
00409     typedef sc_writer_policy_check<POL> policy_type;
00410 
00411 public:
00412 
00413     // constructors and destructor
00414 
00415     sc_signal()
00416       : base_type( sc_gen_unique_name( "signal" ), value_type() )
00417       , m_negedge_event_p( 0 ) , m_posedge_event_p( 0 ) , m_reset_p( 0 )
00418     {}
00419 
00420     explicit
00421     sc_signal( const char* name_ )
00422       : base_type( name_, value_type() )
00423       , m_negedge_event_p( 0 ) , m_posedge_event_p( 0 ) , m_reset_p( 0 )
00424     {}
00425 
00426     sc_signal( const char* name_, const value_type& initial_value_ )
00427       : base_type( name_, initial_value_ )
00428       , m_negedge_event_p( 0 ) , m_posedge_event_p( 0 ) , m_reset_p( 0 )
00429     {}
00430 
00431     virtual ~sc_signal();
00432 
00433     // get the positive edge event
00434     virtual const sc_event& posedge_event() const;
00435 
00436     // get the negative edge event
00437     virtual const sc_event& negedge_event() const;
00438 
00439     // was there a positive edge event?
00440     virtual bool posedge() const
00441         { return ( this->event() && this->m_cur_val ); }
00442 
00443     // was there a negative edge event?
00444     virtual bool negedge() const
00445         { return ( this->event() && ! this->m_cur_val ); }
00446 
00447 
00448     // assignment
00449     this_type& operator = ( const value_type& a )
00450       { base_type::operator=(a); return *this; }
00451 
00452     this_type& operator = ( const sc_signal_in_if<value_type>& a )
00453       { base_type::operator=(a); return *this; }
00454 
00455     this_type& operator = ( const this_type& a )
00456       { base_type::operator=(a); return *this; }
00457 
00458 protected:
00459 
00460     virtual void update();
00461             void do_update();
00462 
00463     virtual bool is_clock() const { return false; }
00464 
00465 protected:
00466     mutable sc_event* m_negedge_event_p; // negative edge event if present.
00467     mutable sc_event* m_posedge_event_p; // positive edge event if present.
00468     mutable sc_reset* m_reset_p;         // reset mechanism if present.
00469 
00470 private:
00471     // reset creation
00472     virtual sc_reset* is_reset() const;
00473 
00474     // disabled
00475     sc_signal( const this_type& ) /* = delete */;
00476 };

00479 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00480 //  CLASS : sc_signal<sc_dt::sc_logic>
00481 //
00482 //  Specialization of sc_signal<T> for type sc_dt::sc_logic.
00483 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00484 
00485 SC_API_TEMPLATE_DECL_ sc_signal_t<sc_dt::sc_logic,SC_ONE_WRITER>;
00486 SC_API_TEMPLATE_DECL_ sc_signal_t<sc_dt::sc_logic,SC_MANY_WRITERS>;
00487 SC_API_TEMPLATE_DECL_ sc_signal_t<sc_dt::sc_logic,SC_UNCHECKED_WRITERS>;
00488 
00489 template< sc_writer_policy POL >
00490 class SC_API sc_signal<sc_dt::sc_logic,POL>
00491   : public sc_signal_t<sc_dt::sc_logic,POL>
00492 {
00493 protected:
00494     typedef sc_signal_t<sc_dt::sc_logic,POL>    base_type;
00495     typedef sc_signal<sc_dt::sc_logic,POL>      this_type;
00496     typedef sc_dt::sc_logic                     value_type;
00497     typedef sc_writer_policy_check<POL> policy_type;
00498 
00499 public:
00500 
00501     sc_signal()
00502       : base_type( sc_gen_unique_name( "signal" ), value_type() )
00503       , m_negedge_event_p( 0 ) , m_posedge_event_p( 0 )
00504     {}
00505 
00506     explicit
00507     sc_signal( const char* name_ )
00508       : base_type( name_, value_type() )
00509       , m_negedge_event_p( 0 ) , m_posedge_event_p( 0 )
00510     {}
00511 
00512     sc_signal( const char* name_, const value_type& initial_value_ )
00513       : base_type( name_, initial_value_ )
00514       , m_negedge_event_p( 0 ) , m_posedge_event_p( 0 )
00515     {}
00516 
00517     virtual ~sc_signal();
00518 
00519     // get the positive edge event
00520     virtual const sc_event& posedge_event() const;
00521 
00522     // get the negative edge event
00523     virtual const sc_event& negedge_event() const;
00524 
00525 
00526     // was there a positive edge event?
00527     virtual bool posedge() const
00528         { return ( this->event() && this->m_cur_val == sc_dt::SC_LOGIC_1 ); }
00529 
00530     // was there a negative edge event?
00531     virtual bool negedge() const
00532         { return ( this->event() && this->m_cur_val == sc_dt::SC_LOGIC_0 ); }
00533 
00534 
00535     // assignment
00536     this_type& operator = ( const value_type& a )
00537       { base_type::operator=(a); return *this; }
00538 
00539     this_type& operator = ( const sc_signal_in_if<value_type>& a )
00540       { base_type::operator=(a); return *this; }
00541 
00542     this_type& operator = ( const this_type& a )
00543       { base_type::operator=(a); return *this; }
00544 
00545 protected:
00546 
00547     virtual void update();
00548             void do_update();
00549 
00550 protected:
00551     mutable sc_event* m_negedge_event_p; // negative edge event if present.
00552     mutable sc_event* m_posedge_event_p; // positive edge event if present.
00553 
00554 private:
00555     // disabled
00556     sc_signal( const this_type& ) /* = delete */;
00557 };
00558 
00559 } // namespace sc_core

00621 // Andy Goodrich:

00623 //       methods, and operators to keep the Microsoft compiler happy.
00624 //   (2) Added delta_count() method to sc_prim_channel for use by

00626 //         can be for a non-templated class (i.e., sc_prim_channel.)
00627 //

00633 // Andy Goodrich: changed sc_event instances into pointers to sc_event instances
00634 // that are allocated as needed. This saves considerable storage for large
00635 // numbers of signals, etc.
00636 //
00637 //Revision 1.10  2006/01/26 21:00:50  acg
00638 // Andy Goodrich: conversion to use sc_event::notify(SC_ZERO_TIME) instead of
00639 // sc_event::notify_delayed()
00640 //
00641 //Revision 1.9  2006/01/24 20:45:41  acg
00642 //Andy Goodrich: converted notify_delayed() calls into notify_next_delta() calls
00643 //to eliminate deprecation warnings. notify_next_delta() is an implemenation-
00644 //dependent method of sc_event. It is simpler than notify_delayed(), and should
00645 //speed up simulation speeds.
00646 //
00647 //Revision 1.8  2006/01/19 19:18:25  acg
00648 //Andy Goodrich: eliminated check_writer in favor of inline code within the
00649 //write() method since we always execute the check_writer code even when
00650 //check writing is turned off.
00651 //
00652 //Revision 1.7  2006/01/19 00:30:57  acg
00653 //Andy Goodrich: Yet another implementation for disabling write checks on
00654 //signals. This version uses an environment variable, SC_SIGNAL_WRITE_CHECK,
00655 //that when set to DISABLE will turn off write checking.
